German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German [Term?], from Old High German bitten, from Proto-Germanic *bidjanÄ…, from Proto-Indo-European *gÊ·Ê°edÊ°-. Compare Low German bidden, Dutch bidden, English bid, Danish bede.

  • IPA(key): /ËˆbÉªtnÌ©/, /ËˆbÉªtÉ™n/

Verb[edit]

bitten (class 5 strong, third-person singular simple present bittet, past tense bat, past participle gebeten, past subjunctive bÃ¤te, auxiliary haben)

  1. (transitive or intransitive) to ask, to beg, to plead, to request
    Wir lieben euchâ€“Entschuldigtâ€“Wir bitten um Verzeihungâ€“Vielen Dank
    We love you, we're sorry, please forgive us, much thanks.
